description: Verify that the module test details page loads correctly with proper authentication
scenario: Admin user navigates to a specific module's test details page to view module-specific tests
expected_results: Display the module test details page with header, module statistics, progress bar, and test plans list
procedure:
1. Log in as admin user
2. Navigate to /admin/system-test/modules/{module_name}
3. Verify page loads completely
4. Check header with module name as title
5. Verify 'Back to Dashboard' and 'New Test Plan' buttons are visible

description: Verify that non-admin users cannot access the module test details page
scenario: Regular user attempts to access module-specific test management functionality
expected_results: Access should be denied with 403 Forbidden error
procedure:
1. Log in as regular user (non-admin)
2. Attempt to navigate to /admin/system-test/modules/Home Page
3. Verify 403 Forbidden error is returned
4. Check redirect to appropriate error page
5. Ensure no module test functionality is accessible

description: Verify module page integrates properly with broader test management workflow
scenario: Admin uses module page as part of complete test management workflow
expected_results: Module page provides seamless integration with dashboard, test creation, execution, and editing
procedure:
1. Navigate from dashboard to module page
2. Create new test plan from module page
3. Execute test from module page
4. Edit test plan from module page
5. Verify all integrations maintain proper context and navigation flow

description: Verify the module progress bar displays correct completion percentage and visual indicators
scenario: Admin views progress bar to quickly assess module test completion status
expected_results: Progress bar shows correct percentage with proper visual styling and text labels
procedure:
1. Locate 'Module Progress' section
2. Verify progress bar shows correct width based on pass rate
3. Check gradient styling (green-400 to green-600)
4. Confirm text shows 'X / Y tests passed' format
5. Verify progress bar animation and smooth transitions

description: Verify the test plans list header displays correct count and filter options
scenario: Admin views test plans list to understand available tests and filtering capabilities
expected_results: Display test plans header with count, status filter, and priority filter dropdowns
procedure:
1. Locate 'Test Plans (X)' header
2. Verify count matches actual number of test plans
3. Check 'All Status' filter dropdown with options: pending, passed, failed, skipped
4. Confirm 'All Priority' filter dropdown with options: low, medium, high, critical
5. Verify filters are properly styled and functional
